headline: Tomato Chicken Parmesan
description: A double cheese effect, as Parmesan-coated chicken swims in a pool of pasta sauce with a blanket of melted Monterey Jack over all.

video.description: See how to make a super-simple baked chicken dinner.
video.name: Tomato Chicken Parmesan

name: Tomato Chicken Parmesan

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Pour beaten eggs into a shallow dish or bowl. In another shallow dish or bowl, mix together the grated Parmesan cheese and bread crumbs. Dip chicken breasts into beaten egg, then into bread crumb mixture to coat.
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium high heat. Add coated chicken and saute for about 8 to 10 minutes each side, or until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear.

Pour tomato sauce into a lightly greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Add chicken, then place a slice of Monterey Jack cheese over each breast, and bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes or until cheese is completely melted.

review.reviewBody: Simple and the whole family loved it

SO GOOD!! I lightly seasoned my chicken with salt, pepper, garlic, basil and italian seasoning. I followed the other reviews and put it in the fridge for about 45min and then I baked it in the oven for about 30min before adding the sauce and cheese. This is definitely a great recipe! Thank you :)

I know the vast majority of reviews are 5 stars. But I don’t get it. If all you do to the chicken is put it in egg and Italian bread crumbs, where is the flavor going to come from? It needs spices or at least salt and pepper. Also, if you sauté your chicken for 8-10 minutes per side and then bake it for anywhere near 20 minutes, it will be over cooked. This wasn’t bad but it had very little flavor and the meat was too done.
Very good and easy to make! definitely will be making it again it was a hit!
This is soooo good! Husband loved it I used Mozzarella for my cheese topping
It was absolutely delicious
Loved it. Really simple. Changed from Monterey Jack to Mozzarella cheese, so much better with marinara sauce. Served over fettuccini. Perfect

This is a keeper! My son loves chicken Parmesan so I thought I’d give it a try for the first time in a long time. I sautéed the chicken as described, then baked it, but I just put a thin layer of sauce under the chicken because I was worried it would get too soggy. I added a thin layer of sauce on top of the chicken. Baked uncovered for 10 minutes, then added shredded mozzarella (all I had on hand) and baked 10 more minutes. Served with spaghetti and the remaining sauce. Chicken was moist, coating was crispy. I used Parmesan herb panko bread crumbs. Delicious!
Yummy! Added additional spices, oregano. garlic salt, cayenne pepper & black pepper to breading. Extra sauce for Max.

I’ve made this about 20 times so I think I should review it. Absolute favorite family dish! I use Raffu sauce and sauté onions, pour the sauce in with diced tomatoes and I always add a chicken bouillon cube, sugar, and Italian seasoning for more flavor. I double bread the chicken. Incredible!
Excellent , I used mozzarella only change and we tasty easy recipe

Surprisingly quick and easy to make. Very filling. My husband who is a basic meat and potato guy thought it was great! In trying to come up with new ways to dress up chicken dinners I happily came across this one. Used a combination of Colby jack and 3 pepper jack for the topping since I didn't have the Monterey Jack called for. I used 2 breasts sliced to make them less thick and used extra sauce as 12 oz. didn't seem to be enough. I didn't need the full 20 min. in the oven, I just waited until the sauce started boiling.
This was an excellent recipe that was easy to make. I don't cook a lot, but was looking for something tasty for dinner with a friend. It was an excellent choice!

Great recipe. I used chicken breast tenderloins since they were already around 3/4" thick. For 1 pound of chicken I only used 1 egg and half the breadcrumb mixture. I will definetly make this again. This recipe was fairly quick and easy to make, and tastes great!
Use half the parm and bread crumbs.
Really good! I add some seasoning but honestly was amazing!
I used chunky sauce and veggie noodles.
Just a few added extras and this was the best chicken parmesan that I made. The sauce was made with fresh tomatoes out of my garden. Even the kids wanted 2nd’s.

Turned out great! Will definitely make again. I changed the cooking. I hate dry chicken and when reading the recipe it sounded like it would be dry. So, I pan fried the chicken for about 3 minutes per side then baked in oven for 20 minutes. The chicken was juicy and tender. Even the left overs heated in the microwave were still moist.
Excellent!!!
I made this recipe as presented. Was quite good!
Yummy!
Added Italian seasoning and garlic
I made no changes but the next time I will add season the chicken.
This is easy and delicious!

Made this for a dinner party and everybody loved it. Used fresh mozzarella on the chicken and paired it with Chef John's Spaghetti Aglio e Olio from this site. Outstanding meal! Thank you for sharing this easy recipe.
Great ! I add some chopped onion garlic and red pepper all mince to marinate the chicken
It’s a keeper! Prep took awhile but the end results was yummy.
This was easy and delicious and my whole family loved it.

This recipe was so easy and so delicious. My family loved it! I took another reviewers advice and baked the chicken in the oven instead of frying it for 20 minutes. I also used mozzarella because that's what I had. Will definitely make this again.

My entire family loved this. The only change I made was using gluten free bread crumbs, because as my name says I have to be gluten free, and I took the suggestion of others to put the breaded chicken in fridge for about 30 minutes before cooking. Even with gluten free bread crumbs it came out crispy and awesome. Definitely putting into dinner rotation.
Great recipe. Easier to just ballpark the Parmesan cheese and bread crumb mixture than to measure it out exactly.

Excellent. Hubby said it was as good as any he has had in a restaurant. I made a few changes as follows: I put salt and peppr on the chicken before breading. After putting the sauce on the bottom of the dish, I saved some to put on the top of the chicken too. I used mozzarella because that's what I had, and put in on the last 10 min not the full 20 min. The breading did not fall off during frying, and I did not refrigerate it as some suggested, so don't bother. Will make again soon.
Delicious
Super easy and delicious! Even well liked by the picky eaters.
Love it! Was super easy and quick to make. Tasted delicious!
This has been our go to chicken parmesan recipe for over a year now! So so yummy!
It was excellent, served with homemade tomato sauce.

Excellant! I made it GLUTON FREE, replacing bread crumbs with almond flour. The 10 women I cooked for in my womens group gave it rave reviews. I improvised on the seasoning , as I often do with recipes.

I really enjoyed this recipe! I used chicken tenderloin, as that's what I had, and it turned out well. Instead of transferring everything to a different pan to bake, I cooked the chicken on the stove top in an oven-safe pan. After the chicken was cooked, I took out the excess oil left from frying, then added the sauce to the pan, and put it in the oven. I agree with other reviewers not to add the cheese until 5 minutes before removing it from the oven, and also you probably only need 1 egg. I used half of a jar of store bought pasta sauce in the chicken and heated the remaining sauce to serve over spaghetti as a side dish.
I don’t consider myself the best cook yet at 22 years old, but I was able to complete this one pretty easily! My boyfriend ate it and said he liked it sooooo, I say success!
Best meal I ever made!! I added garlic powder and onion powder and pepper to the cheese and bread crumb batter. Was so goooood!! Thanks for this!

This Chicken Parm recipe is admirably no-frills. The sort of simple classic that aims to warm the soul rather than seeking to impress. I point this out with respect to the origins of this dish, because what I’m about to suggest may shock future readers. My love of cottage cheese is no secret. I find the combination of its silky rubber texture and mildly salty notes a truly divine expression of human ingenuity. That “melt-in-your-mouth” quality can elevate ANY dish and that’s NOT hyperbole. All this is to say, a 1:1 ratio of Parmesan and cottage cheese takes this recipe to another level. Want to impress the new young neighbors? Influence the mayor to allow for that shed extension despite city zoning codes? Take first place in the Hawthorne middle school Fall Function? Yes to all of the above and more? Then follow my advice and make the chicken coup a cottage.

Flavorful and moist. I appreciated the suggestions to pound the chicken to an even thickness. I used 4 chicken breasts, cut into 8-9 pieces and had just the right amount of coating using one egg and halving the parmesan and bread crumbs as had been suggested. I also added a little garlic powder to the coating and used mozzarella for the cheese.
Made it over riced cauliflower. Was pretty good this way.

yes. It was good but not wonderful. Followed the recipe exactly except for baking the chicken instead of frying. The sauce was thick and heavy but that may be because of the sauce I had bought for another recipe and did not use. I probably will make again using less sauce or a lighter variety. Judi D
yes, we really enjoyed!
Excellent recipe. The family lived it

My husband loves this dish. I do add more sauce because he likes extra sauce. I also switch up the cheese on top with whatever I have, usually mozzarella.
I pan fry in a large heavy nonstick pan and find I have to cook it on medium, but for the same amount of time. 
Thanks for sharing such a wonderful recipe! This is easy and great for company as well.

With a small bit of basil, this chicken is great. With a great deal of tenderness and moisture, this makes the perfect meal. This takes me about an hour to hour 1/2. It costed me 40 bucks. It goes really well with some percitelli pasta. Try your best not to go cheap on this recipe, because some things in this recipe are not very good cheap, ex. Marinara sauce. And use a little extra marinara.
I made this recipe as it seemed quick and easy....although I used mozzarella instead of monterey jack.....family preference. thank you
This turned out really good! My husband ate 3 chicken breasts! ?? he said it was delicious!
I sprinkled some mozzarella and parmesan on top before putting it in the oven, extra cheesy and delicious!
Easy and the whole family loved it!
Turned out great
I added some sliced green peppers to my sauce. Easy meal.
My Family Loved IT!
Delicious!
Changed the cheese tonsliced Monterey and Colby Jack because I couldn't find the kind listed. Other than that it was great!! Will definitely do again.

Because I am from Baton Rouge, La. and we like seasoning and spices I seasoned my chicken breast before coating them with the egg & bread crumbs. I also added Italian seasoning to the filleted chicken breast and the bread crumbs. I took the advice of a previous user and baked my cheese (shredded mozzarella, shredded Parmesan, and sliced Colby Jack) only for the last 5 minutes of the 20 minute bake time and it was perfectly melted. I prepared for an 8 serving size and I thought I should’ve used 1 lb & 1/2 of pasta sauce as I paired the meal with fettuccini noodles. More sauce would add a little moisture to the noodles.

Delicious; my picky family all loved it! For an even quicker version, you can use frozen breaded chicken filets, and skip all the breading & frying time. If you are going to make it from scratch though, the other reviewers are definitely correct about reducint the breadcrumbs & grated parmesan by half; there's simply too much to stick on the chicken.

PS: I always season my spaghetti with a little olive oil & butter, salt and garlic.
Great recipe...guys loved it!
I ended up using tenderloins since that’s what I had handy, but my husband said that it tasted as good as something he’d order at a restaurant! I also used mozzarella on top as well.

Love this!! And will not make the same mistake twice: I breaded the chicken, then put all breasts into the baking dish and covered them with cheese, forgetting to first cook them in the frying pan!! Aaaahhh!! So, I removed the chicken from the dish, gently lifted the cheese off (best I could), and cooked the breasts. They blackened! The tomato sauce, etc., not pretty. STILL, they turned out delicious! Can't wait to try again. :)

This was very good. Being that I don't really measure much, I threw the coating together and would add more parmesan to it. Also didn't have monterey jack, used white cheddar. Used chicken thighs also.
So savory and easy dish to make. Your family will love you!!
Followed the recipe exactly. It was very good. Husband loved it and wants to include on our regular rotation of meals. Simple weeknight meal.
yes for some reason it was very bland. & the time given for baking the chicken was not near long enough. I must have had larger pieces of chicken but not sure what to do for adding flavor.
Was very delicious! Tip: just because the chicken breasts are huge you don’t have to change the cooking time at all.
I made it , loved it and will make it again.
I made it , loved it and will make it again.

Fabulous "chicken parm". Scrumptious - my husband loved it. 
I used my homemade sauce with mushrooms.Reviewers were right - refrigerate breaded chicken breast for 30 minutes to keep breading PERFECT when sauteing. Used extra cheese - mozzarella and provolone. Yum!! Thanks so much.
Very tasty! Easy to make and goes great with pasta. I'll definitely make it again.
This was absolutely delicious and so easy to make. I did not change a thing other than perhaps a little less time in the fry pan. This would be great to make for guests. A keeper for sure!
Used a mixture of Parmesan and Gruyere. Loved it
Just added Salt Pepper & few Shakes Garlic Powder. Yes I will Definately b fixin More.
Great. Very filling. Used provolone cheese.
I made it with boneless skinless chicken thighs. I t still turned out to be a terrific meal. Great for sandwiches the next day.

Loved the recipe but I used mozzarella instead Monterey Jack 
second time I made it.

Only change I made was Used mozzarella on top instead of jack monetary, it turned out really nice but the sauce was not enough as I boiled spaghetti to go with it , next time will use double amount of pasta sauce
this was fantastic ,,, excellent taste ,

Easy, they enjoy it very much.

Thanks
Wife loved it. Will definitely be making it again.
Looked great but as my husband is Gluten Free he used a Rice flour instead of the bread crumbs and dried spices in the flour. Was easy and will make this again.

Excellent, pretty easy for a cook who doesn't like to dirty many pans! Husband thought it was the best chicken parm he's ever had! I think frying the coated chicken first helped seal in the juices and I did cover the chicken which kept it moist while baking. I also added some mozzarella to the colby jack and served it with penne pasta. Delicious:-)
Loved it put over Linguine
I don’t know if I would use this again. I followed the recipie to the T and the breadcrumb covering burnt and in fact I even cooked it at a lower heat then called for and it still burned.
I followed the recommendation to add garlic, put a little sauce on top, and added mozzarella cheese for just the last 8 min. It was delicious!

Loved it! Could someone assist me with this problem? Even if I refrigerate the chicken breadcrumb mixture I find it sticks a bit to the saucepan. I generally spray it, I try different saucepans & it still sticks. My family loves this recipe -very filling.
Followed the recipe and my family loved it!
Tasted great the best
It was delicious!
This was very easy to make and really tasty. My family and dinner guests loved it. This one is a definite keeper.
We was looking at something new and this hit the spot we will be doing this again also its in the family cook book as well.
This was absolutely delicious! My whole family enjoyed it! Will definitely make again!!
I made this staying true to the recipe instructions, and served over bow-tie pasta. Really tasty. A good combination of flavors.
I did like all the other reviewers and changed the recipe completely. (Kidding not kidding). This recipe is great! Try it or change it to your liking. This is a great starter recipe.
Best chicken parm and so easy!

Loved it! Used Rao’s Marinara (the best in my opinion) and used about 20oz. I shop at Krogers and used Private Selection brand of their herb Parmesan panko bread crumbs. Didn’t need to add Parmesan or any other seasonings. I pounded 3 breasts and then shook in flour, then egg wash, then bread crumbs. Fried for only a couple of minutes on each side and then baked in sauce for about 15 min, added sliced fresh mozzarella for a couple more minutes. Hubs loved it! You could also slice the breasts in half horizontally instead of pounding.
